definition: period of time (may be months, or mere seconds)/spare time/skill/labor/effort
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
to put in time and energy/to concentrate one's efforts
to spend a great deal of time and effort/(of a task) demanding/exacting
very concentrated type of tea consumed in Chaozhou, Fujian and Taiwan/variant of 功夫茶[gong1 fu5 cha2]
to maximize one's time/to catch some time out/to find enough time/(also 抓功夫)
to travel far and wide looking for sth, only to find it easily
pinyin: ta4 po4 tie3 xie2 wu2 mi4 chu4 , de2 lai2 quan2 bu4 fei4 gong1 fu5
containing_words.word: 踏破铁鞋无觅处，得来全不费工夫

sentences.english: It is waste of time, admonishing you.
sentences.chinese: 劝告你简直是浪费工夫。

sentences.english: During the growing season there is no time for socializing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 在作物生长季节，根本就没工夫参加社交活动。

sentences.english: In other parts of China, tea-drinking rules are different from that of gongfu tea.
sentences.chinese: 其实，大部分地区的饮茶习俗都与闽南的工夫茶不同。

sentences.english: People put great effort into their products and exhibits in the hope of winning an award.
sentences.chinese: 人们在参展品上花很多工夫，希望赢得奖项。

sentences.english: She conjured up a whole meal in a jiffy.
sentences.chinese: 一眨眼工夫她就变出了一桌饭菜。

sentences.english: The autumn of vegetable didn't know at mother to descend there how much time, get her to like preferably.
sentences.chinese: 素秋不知在朱嬷嬷那里下了多少工夫，颇得她的喜欢。

sentences.english: His head drooped down and a few minutes later he fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 他低垂着脑袋，一会儿工夫就睡着了。

sentences.english: He dressed himself laboriously every morning and afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 他每天早晨和下午花不少工夫梳洗打扮。

sentences.english: The tailor stitched the split seam in seconds.
sentences.chinese: 裁缝一会儿工夫就把破缝缝好了。

sentences.english: Vijnaptimatrata from two respects of theory and"the free time"to describe this question.
sentences.chinese: 唯识学是从理论和“工夫”两方面进行的。

sentences.english: It took me half an hour to hale the heavy box down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我费了半个小时的工夫才把那只重箱子拖到楼下。

sentences.english: From summer to winter, may be it was a long time.
sentences.chinese: 从炎天到冬天，大概是更长的工夫。

sentences.english: Because after each use environmental protection bags are cleaning, gardening takes more bother than.
sentences.chinese: 因为环保袋每次用完都要清洗，很费工夫。

sentences.english: In the time for a leaf to fall in one place, a flower could bloom in another.
sentences.chinese: 此地一片树叶飘下的工夫，彼地一朵花盛开了。

sentences.english: Whtowouls the time limit for the reinspection?
sentences.chinese: 复验的时限是什么工夫？

definition: to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
a portion smaller than a half/the lesser part/the smaller part
in a flash/in the blink of an eye/to glance
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
